name: Jarl Korir

aspects.trouble: Blames the College for the Great Collapse—And Won't Forgive
other_aspects: Proud Remnant of a Once-Great Hold
Suspicious of All Outsiders, Especially Mages

stunts: Voice of Winterhold: +2 to Rapport when speaking for his hold or its grievances
Unwavering Resolve: +2 to Will when resisting magical, political, or emotional manipulation
Remember the Collapse: Once per session, invoke memory of lost Winterhold to gain +2 on any action defending what remains
notes: Jarl Korir is the embittered ruler of Winterhold Hold, watching over the ruins of what was once a prosperous city. The Great Collapse destroyed most of Winterhold, and Korir—like many locals—blames the College of Winterhold for the catastrophe. He's suspicious, guarded, and deeply resentful. Despite this, he's a capable leader doing his best to protect his people with minimal resources. He supports the Stormcloaks but receives little aid due to Winterhold's strategic insignificance.
combat_tactics: Korir is a competent warrior but not exceptional. He fights with one-handed weapon and shield in traditional Nord style—defensive but aggressive when protecting his people. He'll prioritize his citizens' safety over personal glory. In civil war scenarios, he'll defend Winterhold fiercely but knows when to yield to superior force.
social_interaction: Korir is guarded and suspicious, especially with outsiders and anyone associated with the College. He speaks of Winterhold's past glory with bitter nostalgia. He's more forthcoming with fellow Nords and Stormcloak sympathizers, but even then maintains distance. Those who prove themselves helpful to Winterhold (not the College) can earn grudging respect. He's haunted by responsibility for dwindling population.

relationships.College of Winterhold: Blames them for the Great Collapse, deep resentment and distrust
relationships.Stormcloaks: Loyal supporter, wishes they could spare more aid for Winterhold
relationships.Ulfric Stormcloak: Respects and supports, disappointed by lack of material support
relationships.Imperial Legion: Distrusts, sees as occupiers and enemies
relationships.Kraldar: Imperial-backed alternative Jarl if Empire wins Winterhold
relationships.Winterhold Citizens: Protects fiercely, feels responsible for their hardship
relationships.Thalmor: Despises, but less immediate concern than College
relationships.Party: Suspicious unless they prove anti-College or pro-Winterhold stance

personality_notes.speaking_style: Bitter and guarded, speaks of past glory, short and clipped with strangers, warming slightly to allies
motivations: Protect what remains of Winterhold and its people
See the College held accountable for the Collapse
Support Stormcloak cause for independent Skyrim
Restore some measure of Winterhold's former status
Prove his leadership despite overwhelming challenges
fears: Another disaster destroying what little remains
Being forced to accept Imperial rule
Failing the few citizens who remain
quirks: Gestures toward ruins when speaking of past
Pauses before mentioning the College, jaw tightening

great_collapse_trauma.event: Most of Winterhold fell into the Sea of Ghosts around 4E 122
great_collapse_trauma.cause_belief: Locals blame College magical experiments for destabilizing ground
great_collapse_trauma.reality: True cause uncertain—College denies responsibility, geological factors possible
great_collapse_trauma.impact: City reduced from major hold capital to handful of buildings on cliff edge
great_collapse_trauma.korir_experience: Became Jarl after disaster, entire leadership defined by this tragedy
great_collapse_trauma.political_consequence: Winterhold stripped of influence, College now larger than town

civil_war_position.reasoning: Empire represents outsider authority, Stormcloaks are fellow Nords
civil_war_position.irony: Receives minimal support from either side due to strategic worthlessness
civil_war_position.if_imperial_victory: Replaced by Kraldar, an Imperial-aligned Jarl
civil_war_position.if_stormcloak_victory: Remains in power but still receives minimal aid
civil_war_position.college_neutrality: Resents that College won't take side, sees as cowardice

college_relations.official_stance: Tolerates College presence due to lack of power to remove them
college_relations.personal_belief: College destroyed Old Winterhold through reckless magic
college_relations.practical_reality: College is larger and wealthier than town itself
college_relations.resentment: College members cross his bridge to enter town, reminder of power imbalance
college_relations.opportunities: Any evidence of College wrongdoing exploited immediately
college_relations.party_implications: College members face suspicion in town, potential conflicts

story_hooks: Petitions party to investigate College for evidence of wrongdoing
Requests help with local threats (bandits, creatures) that he lacks resources to handle
Civil war missions if party is Stormcloak-aligned
Potential conflict if party defends College against his accusations
May be deposed if Imperials win civil war
Could become grudging ally if party helps Winterhold without helping College

dialogue_samples.greeting: You're new here. Good. Maybe you won't bring more disaster to Winterhold. State your business.
dialogue_samples.about_college: *jaw tightens* The College. They sit up there in their stone fortress while the rest of us scrape by in the ruins of what they destroyed. Don't expect me to speak well of them.
dialogue_samples.about_collapse: You see this? *gestures to cliffs* That used to be a great city. Streets, markets, walls—all of it gone. Fell into the sea. And up there *points to College*, they deny responsibility. Deny it!
dialogue_samples.stormcloak_loyalty: Ulfric understands what it means to be a true Nord. The Empire? They'd sell us to the Thalmor. At least Ulfric fights for Skyrim, even if he can't spare much for Winterhold.
dialogue_samples.earning_trust: *slight nod* You've proven yourself useful to my hold. That's... appreciated. Winterhold remembers its friends. We're few, but we're loyal.

alternative_jarl.name: Kraldar
alternative_jarl.condition: Installed if Imperial Legion wins Winterhold during civil war
alternative_jarl.personality: Less bitter, more pragmatic, accepts College presence
alternative_jarl.policies: More cooperative with Empire and College, less interesting dramatically
alternative_jarl.story_impact: Korir's displacement can be used for exile plotlines or resistance movements

gm_notes: Korir is defined by loss and bitterness. He's not a villain but an antagonist to College-friendly parties. His suspicions aren't entirely unfounded—College's neutrality during civil war seems callous from his perspective, and magical catastrophe is plausible explanation for Collapse. Use him to create tension between party and College if they become too cozy with mages. He can be won over through actions benefiting Winterhold specifically, creating interesting political dynamics. His potential replacement by Kraldar provides civil war stakes. Remember: he's tragic figure, not tyrant—he's doing his best with impossible situation.
